content.description:
Chimney your way up, moving right as necessary. Deeper in is probably more secure, but is mossy and out of reach of the bolts.

At the top traverse right and up over the chockstone. There's probably optional gear here.
content.protection: Two bolts, bolts with rings at the top.
content.location: Head to the right side of the cliff on the PCT. Left of some overhanging roofs you'll see this chimney (left of Karl/Jim's Overhang)

content.description:
This climb is primarily face climbing with a lieback flake in the middle. It ends ends with quality, slightly overhung crimping up to the anchors.

Access the anchors through a 3rd/4th class scramble up and right of the climb.

This problem is a very short bolted route just to the right of Karls overhang. It ascends the obvious green lichen covered overhang. A thin entry leads to powerful bouldery moves past the face and over the lip. The crux is reaching the lip. Once over the lip you climb easy (if runout) terrain to a bolted anchor.
content.location: This route is the obvious green face to the right of Karl's Overhang. It can be easily seen from the PCT trail when passing around School Rock.

content.description:
Climb a beautiful, yet sustained 15 foot overhanging roof crack, located to the left of Short Subject.

Absolutely stellar yet challenging hand/fist jams to a fantastic pull at the lip.

Becareful, deck potential is possible if not careful on this route!
content.protection:
Cams or/and passive from .4" up to 2", an optional 3.5" might be useful, doubles in .5-1" useful.

No anchors at top, build your own.
content.location:
School rock, look for short subject, and look about 15 feet over to see a very distinct hand fist overhanging roof crack, don't mistake the thin finger overhanging crack to the immediate left of short subject for Karl's Overhang!

Start is a distinct fist crack into roof crack.

Getting down is a scramble back down

content.description: This route tackles the steep overhang up some of the most unique moves and holds in Donner. All the holds are very large and positive, but due to the space between holds and how steep the line is it checks in at 5.11b. Climb up the easy face to a horizontal and reach up place a piece under the giant flake. Power out to the flake and over while campusing across the flake. Throw a heel and clip the bolt. Head out left to the arete and obvious crack and top out. Amazing line.
content.protection: Mixed trad line. The bottom part of the route before the bolt is protected both in the horizontal right below the overhang and in the obvious ginormous flake. After the bolt you can protect the small crack at the top without any danger to hitting the ground. There are two bolts at the top with no rap rings? We left a bail biner through one of the anchor bolts to lower off (6/9/11). You can walk off by scrambling up and then to the right to get down.
content.location: This route is located about 100ft to left of Karls Overhang on a steep short overhanging roof. From Karl's Overhang traverse the cliff line until you reach an overhang with a bolt halfway up the wall.
